At just under 2500 feet of climbing, Mission Peak begs to be climbed. Having a good experience on it requires a bit of care though. Two things you can count on are that it will be sunny, and it will be busy. On a regular weekend, you can easily expect to see a couple hundred fellow travelers on the trail.

12th Street Oakland

It's a straight shot on the BART from Oakland to Mission Peak. At about a 35-minute trip, the duration is nearly identical to the drive along Interstate 880 and frankly much more pleasant.

Warm Springs/South Fremont

The approach from the Warm Springs BART station slopes very gently upward and has relatively little traffic. While the run is pretty easy, I'd dressed for the sun which would follow and found myself woefully unprepared for the chilly morning temperatures.

One thing I wrestled with when starting this project—which in fact prevented me from taking it on earlier—was navigating how to bring out the positive aspects without turning it into a snarky, backhanded jab at cars. So it's with only the warmest possible enthusiasm for all the hikers who woke up and declared "Today is a good day to hike a 2500-foot hill!" that I do have to note my surprise at the hundreds of cars lining every road leading to the Mission Peak trailhead.
